intro: Agrostis haenkeana, commonly known as the New Zealand hairgrass, is a perennial grass species native to New Zealand. It typically grows in moist, temperate environments such as wetlands and stream banks. The plant has slender,丛生 stems with narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its inflorescence consists of a dense cluster of spikelets, which are small, compact flower clusters. Agrostis haenkeana plays an important role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
